result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Lamont Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court.  
Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Jason Lamont Smith.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing.
Court is unavailable for today's proceedings.
Defense request a adjournment.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 5, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court, appear in person with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45. Court notified defendant with conditions with Justice Point.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason Lamont Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
